paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR variants S52P and L111M, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

patients.phenotype: early and severe cardiac involvement with dysautonomia symptoms, peripheral neuropathy, and ophthalmopathy

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Five out of 12 siblings developed progressive cardiac failure in their 40s due to a prominent TTR amyloid cardiomyopathy.

functional_data.summary: S52P TTR is highly susceptible to proteolysis and has a shorter lag phase in fibrillogenesis compared to L111M.

variants.additional_notes: The S52P variant is always associated with early and severe cardiac involvement.
key_quotes: This variant is always associated with early and severe cardiac involvement with dysautonomia symptoms, peripheral neuropathy, and ophthalmopathy.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Five out of 12 siblings developed progressive cardiac failure in their 40s due to a prominent TTR amyloid cardiomyopathy.

functional_data.summary: L111M TTR shows enhanced susceptibility to cleavage and a lower tendency to form fibrils compared to S52P.

variants.additional_notes: The L111M variant is associated with a prominent TTR amyloid cardiomyopathy.
key_quotes: The pathogenic role of the L111M single-mutation was first described by Frederiksen et al. (1962) in a large Danish kindred.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
